New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers improved to a 7-0 record, one win away from their best start in franchise history
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points including a game-winning jumper with three-tenths of a second left
Damian Lillard had 41 points with nine assists and shot 10 of 15 from 3-point range
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers were missing Caris LeVert due to a sore right knee
The Bucks played without Khris Middleton, who hasn't made his season debut yet due to ankle surgery
Post-Match Reflections: Milwaukee has lost five straight since winning its opener
The Bucks wasted a brilliant performance from Damian Lillard
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers showed their gumption by winning at less than full strength
The Bucks need more from Gary Trent Jr., who scored three points in 34 minutes
Others: The teams meet again Monday in Cleveland
